title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 28 June 2012 - XWiki
content:
00:03 <Denis> has quit  
00:04 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
00:43 <CIA-35> Andreas Jonsson master \* rc7b4d84 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-rendering/commit/c7b4d84e8c9acf1cc55c990549b5903eca7ce40f / (3 files in 2 dirs): XRENDERING-215: Ambiguous lexical analyzis due to escape character - http://git.io/TzcaEg  
01:03 <evalica> has quit  
01:58 <ssavi> sdumitriu:Hi  
01:58 <@sdumitriu> Hi ssavi  
02:00 <ssavi> I wanted to check if the user has access to the document in the relevantsearch().  
02:01 <ssavi> Tried using XWiki.checkAccess(). But it looks like it is expecting XWikiDocument as the argument.  
02:06 <ssavi> sdumitriu: Tried looking for the recent documentation but in vain :( . It would be really helpful if you could point out to the resource.  
02:07 <Enygma`> has quit  
02:25 <@sdumitriu> ssavi: org.xwiki.bridge.DocumentAccessBridge.isDocumentViewable(DocumentReference)  
02:25 <ssavi> sdumitriu: Thanks a lot :)  
02:30 <tekzilla> has quit  
02:32 <tekzilla> has joined #xwiki  
04:47 <polx> has quit

05:25 <iamcorbin> Hi, I just started using Xwiki 4.1.2 and I'm trying to add a dashboard to a page in a space. So far the only thing I can get working is  {{dashboard source="Dashboard.SpaceDashboardTemplate"/}} but I can't seem to edit anything  
05:28 <iamcorbin> I have tried following the instructions at: http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Dashboard+Macro but adding {{dashboard/}} doesn't give me any "Add Gadget" button

09:52 <vmassol> cool incremental compilation coming to IntelliJ: http://confluence.jetbrains.net/display/IDEADEV/IDEA+12+EAP  
10:08 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
10:35 <ssavi> sdumitriu: Hi  
10:43 <ssavi> Is there a way of knowing the current language and the set of possible languages for a  wiki from the velocity code?  
10:46 <+tmortagne> ssavi: $xcontext.language for the current language I think  
10:47 <+tmortagne> as for the possible languages it depends exactly what you want  
10:47 <+tmortagne> there is the existing translations of a document and the configured list of languages in the admin which are two different things  
10:48 <+tmortagne> the configured language are in the XWiki.XWikiPreferences object in XWiki.XWikiPreferences page  
10:49 <ssavi> oh .k Thanks a lot  
10:49 <ssavi> thomas :)  
10:49 <+tmortagne> you'r welcome  
10:52 <tmortagne> has quit  
10:52 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
11:07 <Denis2> is now known as <Denis>  
11:33 <jvelo\_> has joined #xwiki  
11:35 <jvelo> has quit  
11:35 <jvelo\_> is now known as <jvelo>  
11:53 <polx> has quit  
11:54 <jvelociter> has joined #xwiki  
11:54 <jvelociter> mflorea, hi  
11:54 <+mflorea> Hi jvelociter  
11:54 <jvelociter> I have a "Cannot allocate memory" error trying to build the WYSIWYG  
11:54 <jvelociter> does it ring a bell ?  
11:55 <+mflorea> no  
11:55 <+mflorea> never seen this  
11:55 <jvelociter> (I have MAVEN\_OPTS precise a large enough Xmx)  
11:55 <jvelociter> ok  
11:55 <+mflorea> you have the latest source?  
11:56 <+tmortagne> jvelociter: you buld only the WYSIWYG or the whole platform ?  
11:56 <jvelociter> no actually it's the branch where I've started the split in several modules  
11:56 <jvelociter> tmortagne, just the WYSIWYG  
11:56 <+mflorea> do you get this with -Pdev? or are you building all the permutations  
11:56 <+tmortagne> what is the exact error you get ?  
11:57 <jvelociter> -Pdev yes  
11:57 <jvelociter> just launched a new build without Pdev  
11:57 <jvelociter> I' ll paste the output  
11:57 <+mflorea> hmm, you shouldn't have any memory problems with -Pdev..  
11:57 <jvelociter> yes that's the strange thing  
12:02 <jvelociter> hmmm maybe my fault..  
12:11 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
12:16 <CIA-114> Vincent Massol master \* r45ab7a4 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-rendering/commit/45ab7a4421813332f46e97a56b34dab404485e52 / xwiki-rendering-archetype-macro/pom.xml : [Misc] Make Clover work again on xwiki-rendering by skipping archetype integration tests when the Clover profile is active - http://git.io/E7MmyA  
12:16 <jvelociter> yes it was a bad merge  
12:16 <jvelociter> strange error though  
12:50 <polx> has quit  
12:50 <mflorea> has quit  
12:56 <vmassol> Groovy 2.0 released!  
12:58 <jvelociter> yay !  
12:59 <jvelociter> maybe we can benefit from the modularization  
13:02 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
13:10 <polx> has quit  
13:16 <vmassol> tmortagne: wdyt about building rendernig-standalone and installers only if the release profile is active?  
13:17 <vmassol> right now for rendering-standalone there's a problem because if you build commons and rendernig offline with no profile rendering-standalone fails to build  
13:18 <vmassol> s/tmortagne/tmortagne and everyone else/  
13:18 <vmassol> :)  
13:20 <vmassol> tmortagne: could you improve the description for commons-repository, I don't know what it is about.   <description>XWiki Commons - Repository</description>  
13:20 <vmassol> also don't forget to edit http://commons.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/WebHome  
13:20 <vmassol> also the packages are not correct  
13:21 <vmassol> comomns repository shouldn't be in an extension package  
13:21 <vmassol> strike that, you've kept this for backward compat, these needs to be moved to a legacy module  
13:21 <vmassol> (if possible)  
13:22 <vmassol> Resources.java says: "\* Resources to use to access Extension Manager REST service."  
13:22 <vmassol> I think the notion of Extension needs to be removed from the comomns repository module,r ight?  
13:22 <vmassol> (I have yet to understand what a generic repository means though)  
13:23 <vmassol> and the difference bwteen a generic repo and an extension repo  
13:24 <vmassol> I don't remember discussions about, have I missed some mails?  
13:39 <+tmortagne> there is only one kind of reposiitory and it's a repository of extension it's not a generic one (whatever that would mean)  
13:40 <vmassol> so why is not under the extension module?  
13:40 <+tmortagne> I just moved it to its own module because extension is starting to be big and it's technically pretty different  
13:40 <vmassol> s/is/is it/  
13:40 <vmassol> I don't agree, it's full of extension keywoirds everywhere  
13:40 <vmassol> just search for extension in it  
13:41 <vmassol> you mean that the "extension" notion in repository is not the same notion as in xwiki-commons-extension?  
13:41 <+tmortagne> re rendering-standalone yes it's useless when not releasing  
13:42 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
13:47 <ssavi> has quit  
13:53 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
13:57 <+tmortagne> groovy 2.0 released  
13:57 <vmassol> tmortagne: see above :)  
13:57 <vmassol> 12:53  
13:58 <+tmortagne> indeed skipped it  
14:15 <CIA-114> tmortagne master \* r9b037b0 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/9b037b0a9cf6bc3c9c44952ee4e974880ac06c63 / (3 files in 3 dirs): XWIKI-7984: Jboss AS 7 does not like jython - http://git.io/S8Rb9Q  
14:15 <CIA-114> tmortagne stable-4.1.x \* r28f0509 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/28f0509a56f09663bad8f25b8f40f6699f7a50dd / (3 files in 3 dirs): XWIKI-7984: Jboss AS 7 does not like jython - http://git.io/5Lv0aQ  
14:17 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
14:17 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
14:32 <CIA-114> Vincent Massol master \* r5918284 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-commons/commit/5918284d6cd75afc209c0568d9efe3b8ca4170fe / xwiki-commons-tools/xwiki-commons-tool-xar/xwiki-commons-tool-xar-plugin/src/main/java/org/xwiki/tool/xar/AbstractXARMojo.java : XCOMMONS-207: XAR Plugin fails to create XAR when there are non XML files in target/classes - http://git.io/NlQJxg  
14:40 <CIA-114> tmortagne master \* r3edd021 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/3edd0211986145789742cb7e4d8be90846ef4c5f / (3 files in 3 dirs): Revert "XWIKI-7984: Jboss AS 7 does not like jython" - http://git.io/5oyADQ  
14:40 <CIA-114> tmortagne stable-4.1.x \* r1730a82 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/1730a82ddc5a54835e44abb204b8c5653f84e26d / (3 files in 3 dirs): Revert "XWIKI-7984: Jboss AS 7 does not like jython" - http://git.io/IIQEPQ  
14:56 <vmassol> tmortagne: sorry for asking clarifications about 2 things you did today (commons repository and JBoss7 fix)… I have nothing against you today! :) I'm just catching up and trying to understand what we're doing  
15:14 <CIA-114> Vincent Massol master \* rdeddc24 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/deddc2414631f2550ab6b706d9d47588ed7a7c02 / xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-index/xwiki-platform-index-ui/pom.xml : [Misc] Fixed invalid dependency - http://git.io/tL\_UAA  
15:15 <CIA-114> Vincent Massol stable-4.1.x \* re88aa71 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/e88aa71b515b3702c0be3a64e8ebfc1d788115ca / xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-index/xwiki-platform-index-ui/pom.xml : [Misc] Fixed invalid dependency - http://git.io/vxsPpQ  
15:17 <iamcorbin> has joined #xwiki  
15:19 <vmassol> tmortagne: I think I've just fixed a regression introduced by your commit of yesteday in the livetable module  
15:19 <vmassol> you might want to check other places in the build too  
15:19 <+tmortagne> a regression ?  
15:20 <vmassol> I'm not sure but I think  
15:20 <vmassol> you've created a livetable-ui module  
15:20 <+tmortagne> all I did is renaming projects  
15:20 <vmassol> right?  
15:20 <+tmortagne> I renamed livetable into livetable-ui  
15:20 <vmassol> yep  
15:20 <vmassol> the regression is  
15:20 <+tmortagne> I did not created anything new  
15:20 <vmassol> in index-ui pom.xml  
15:20 <vmassol> there's a dep on livetable xar  
15:21 <vmassol> as in several other places I assume  
15:21 <+tmortagne> sure I might have forgot to renamed some dependncies  
15:21 <vmassol> well I've just spent 30 minutes trying to understand and rebuild my code locally ;)  
15:21 <vmassol> so you might want to search the build  
15:21 <vmassol> for other places  
15:21 <+tmortagne> I was about to clean the snapshot repository from old versins  
15:21 <vmassol> I've just fixed one place  
15:21 <+tmortagne> we will see quickly the wrong dependencies  
15:22 <vmassol> yes this is what I'm doing locally  
15:22 <vmassol> but not for this reason  
15:22 <vmassol> becuase I'm trying to generate clover data  
15:22 <vmassol> it's taking real long  
15:22 <vmassol> I'll have to rebuild the whole thing now probably :(  
15:22 <vmassol> anyway, please check it  
15:23 <vmassol> also  
15:23 <vmassol> I don't understand why we have livetable-ui?  
15:23 <vmassol> is it because you're moving other stuff soon?  
15:28 <vmassol> hmm I need to modify the packager plugin to add the clover jar in the gnerated distribution when the clover profile is on….  
15:29 <vmassol> or I can simply add a profile to all IT  
15:29 <vmassol> yeah probably simpler  
15:31 <iamcorbin> Hi, I just started using Xwiki 4.1.2 and I'm trying to add a dashboard to a page in a space. So far the only thing I can get working is  {{dashboard source="Dashboard.SpaceDashboardTemplate"/}} but I can't seem to edit anything  
15:31 <iamcorbin> I have tried following the instructions at: http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Dashboard+Macro but adding {{dashboard/}} doesn't give me any "Add Gadget" button  
15:43 <jvdrean> has joined #xwiki  
15:49 <vdox2> sdumitriu: hi  
15:50 <vdox2> about the xwiki geronimo jndi datasource(whew!) problem: I was checking the sources at "at com.xpn.xwiki.store.hibernate.DefaultHibernateSessionFactory$1.replaceVariables(DefaultHibernateSessionFactory.java:160)"  
15:50 <vdox2> that method tries to use hibernate property Environment.URL which is supposed to be unset with JNDI  
15:51 <vdox2> so that's why nullpointerexception is thrown, as far as I can see  
15:54 <+sburjan> iamcorbin: try editing in Inline mode  
15:55 <@sdumitriu> vdox2: Hi  
15:55 <@sdumitriu> vdox2: Ah, vmassol might be responsible for that  
15:56 <vdox2> but it's weird, that should break all instances of xwiki that use jndi, right? How come nobody has noticed that before?  
15:56 <vdox2> (okay, i'm using snapshot, but still)  
15:59 <vdox2> the workaround is simple of course: <property name="connection.url">foo</property>  
15:59 <vdox2> :)  
16:00 <sdumitriu> has quit  
16:01 <sdumitriu> has joined #xwiki  
16:01 <vdox2> sdumitriu: shall i file a bug/issue about that ?  
16:02 <@sdumitriu> vdox2: Yes  
16:02 <vdox2> ok, cool  
16:02 <@sdumitriu> Nobody noticed it before because it's a recent change, it's new for 4.1  
16:02 <vdox2> ok  
16:02 <@sdumitriu> Mark it as blocker  
16:03 <vdox2> yeah  
16:05 <vmassol> sorry guys I'm not following, trying to fix something ATM, yes file a bug with explanations and I can look at it later  
16:05 <vdox2> vmassol: i'm on it :)  
16:06 <vmassol> jus broke build on 4.1, fixing  
16:07 <@sdumitriu> vdox2: If you have a fix, a pull request on github would be more than welcome!  
16:07 <@sdumitriu> :)  
16:07 <CIA-114> Vincent Massol stable-4.1.x \* rf18f2f7 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/f18f2f7053528829ed6179dccc2aed5210860915 / xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-index/xwiki-platform-index-ui/pom.xml : Revert "[Misc] Fixed invalid dependency" - http://git.io/74zthw  
16:12 <vmassol> funny, just got a mail with:  
16:12 <vmassol> "Hello i m french and would like to post on the mailing list but i am rejected. Can you help me?"  
16:12 <vmassol> my answer:  
16:12 <vmassol> "The fact that you are rejected has nothing to do with the fact that you are French, believe me! :)"  
16:12 <iamcorbin> sburjan: how do you edit in Inline mode?  
16:12 <vmassol> (and then: "It just means you're not subscribed to the list or not posting with the mail with which you have subscribed." but that's less funny)  
16:14 <+sburjan> iamcorbin: platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Features/PageEditing. You have to switch your user to Advanced mode (if you are not logged in as Admin)  
16:15 <vdox2> sdumitriu: ah, maybe next time ;)  
16:15 <vdox2> sdumitriu: I did put a fix suggestion in the issue though  
16:15 <vdox2> vmassol: FYI, here's the issue XE-1203  
16:16 <iamcorbin> sburjan: awesome, thank you  
16:16 <iamcorbin> the documentation should include that step  
16:17 <+sburjan> iamcorbin: it does  
16:18 <+sburjan> iamcorbin: http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Features/PageEditing#HAdvancedMode  
16:19 <iamcorbin> sburjan:  it doesn't mention it on the dashboard macro page though - http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Dashboard+Macro  
16:24 <iamcorbin> Is there a way to tell {{spaceindex}} to only list first level pages and not sub pages?  
16:26 <+sburjan> it doesn't seem to have a such parameter  
16:29 <@sdumitriu> iamcorbin: Nope, but you can modify the sources of that macro so that it only lists documents with parent = space's WebHome or empty  
16:29 <@sdumitriu> Actually, modifiying official documents is a bad practice, since it makes it harder to upgrade, so you should copy it and make a new macro out of it  
16:31 <iamcorbin> I did find this ( http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/List+Children+Of+Current+Document ) velocity code and used it on a page to display children (and set $depth to 1), it works fine on a page, but using it on a dashboard as a gadget tells me : Failed to execute the [velocity] macro  
16:32 <vmassol> nested script execution error probably  
16:32 <vmassol> (you can click on the message)  
16:32 <vmassol> (to get details)  
16:33 <iamcorbin> yep  
16:33 <iamcorbin> nested scripts are not allowed  
16:33 <iamcorbin> so how would I use that in a gadget?  
16:34 <vmassol> let me check, I think this was fixed recently  
16:34 <iamcorbin> ok  
16:34 <vmassol> http://jira.xwiki.org/jira/browse/XWIKI-7872  
16:35 <vmassol> what version are you using?  
16:35 <iamcorbin> 4.1.2  
16:35 <vmassol> then something is amiss  
16:35 <vmassol> Enygma`: any idea?  
16:36 <+Enygma`> reading  
16:37 <@sdumitriu> iamcorbin: Maybe you used that snippet wrongly? Did you put it inside another {{velocity}} block?  
16:37 <@sdumitriu> pastebin the whole code of the gadget  
16:38 <iamcorbin> sdumitriu: problem solved  
16:38 <iamcorbin> I pasted the same code that still was surrounded by {{velocity}}  
16:38 <iamcorbin> works now, thanks  
16:39 <vmassol> hmm  
16:39 <+Enygma`> right... I also did a quick test and velocity macros inside gadget content work, but of course, only 1 level :)  
16:39 <vmassol> looks worng  
16:39 <vmassol> we consider gadgets to contain velcoity by default?  
16:40 <+Enygma`> no  
16:41 <+Enygma`> or actually, I don`t know  
16:41 <vmassol> iamcorbin: can you paste your content?  
16:41 <vmassol> the whole content of your gadget  
16:41 <vmassol> in wiki syntax  
16:42 <+Enygma`> a quick test:  
16:42 <+Enygma`> having this is a gadget`s content:  
16:42 <+Enygma`> {{velocity}}  
16:42 <+Enygma`> $doc.fullName  
16:42 <+Enygma`> {{/velocity}}  
16:42 <+Enygma`> Again: $doc.fullName  
16:42 <+Enygma`> outputs:  
16:42 <+Enygma`> Dashboard.WebHome  
16:42 <+Enygma`> Again: $doc.fullName  
16:42 <+Enygma`> so the answer is no :)  
16:42 <iamcorbin> same as I posted above, just using this code ( http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/List+Children+Of+Current+Document )  
16:42 <iamcorbin> under For XWiki Syntax 2.0  
16:44 <vmassol> ok got it  
16:44 <vmassol> iamcorbin: you were adding the velocity gadget and as its content you were using {{velocity}}....  
16:45 <iamcorbin> correct, that removing the surrounding {{velocity}}...{{/velocity}} tags fixed the problem  
16:45 <vmassol> ok problem solved  
16:45 <vmassol> thanks  
16:46 <iamcorbin> no thank you  
16:46 <iamcorbin> but I do still have another question. I am trying to figure out velocity code by starting with trying to understand how that snippet I posted works, but I can't find those calls in the API so I'm not sure where to look  
16:47 <iamcorbin> starting with "#macro" and "createDocumentTree"  
16:47 <+tmortagne> #macro is velocity syntax itself, not really API  
16:48 <+tmortagne> see http://velocity.apache.org/engine/devel/user-guide.html  
16:48 <+tmortagne> what is the complete call with createDocumentTree ?  
16:48 <iamcorbin> oh, I thought velocity was Xwiki specific that helps  
16:48 <iamcorbin> #macro(createDocumentTree $document $depth $level)  
16:49 <+tmortagne> ok so #macro is used to define a velocity macro you can then call in another code, sort of method without a return  
16:49 <+tmortagne> createDocumentTree will be the name of the macro  
16:49 <+tmortagne> so after this you can calls #createDocumentTree($document, $depth, $level)  
16:50 <iamcorbin> ok cool, that apache page will help  
16:50 <+tmortagne> you probavaly have it if you do a search  
16:50 <+tmortagne> \*probably  
16:50 <iamcorbin> yeah, it's in the last line  
16:53 <iamcorbin> thanks, time to do some studying now that I have a better idea of what's going on now. I'm really liking Xwiki so far and appreciate this helpful community!  
16:53 <+tmortagne> always nice to hear :)  
17:00 <iamcorbin> in case you are interested, I'm using it with a friend I went to college with who has a consulting business in Chicago (I just moved to Grand Rapids, MI and am starting my own consulting business here) and he just set it up on his local network that I vpn into through a windows7 virtual machine (I run Ubuntu). He is getting swamped with work and is going to start subcontracting stuff to me and we are going to use Xwiki as a place to  
17:00 <iamcorbin> organize client information and consulting resources
